divs: sighting detailsi was standing on the passenger deck of the queen of saltspring, island ferry, as it traveled southbound from saltspring island to swartz bay, north of victoria, b.c. using binoculars, i was following a pair of cormorants darting about one-another, one-hundred yards east of the boat. they appeared to be at a height of between seventy and one-hundred feet above the ocean water. i then saw what appeared to be an extremely bright, circular blob, of mercury\chrome light, above them and further east. i describe it as a blob because the light resembled a blob of mercury undulating very slightly, from oval to round. and chrome, because it resembled the bright, shiny bluish surface of freshly polished chrome. i would say that it appeared to be about three-kilometers in distance (there are small islands dotting the region) and it was clearly between our ferry and morseby island further east at thirty to forty degrees above the horizon. my very first impression was, that it was the landing light of an aircraft on approach to victoria international airport, to the south\west of our position. the light then immediately changed its shape to that of a long cigar shape. my first impression was, that it was three-hundred feet in length. now, its shading appeared to be like brushed aluminum similar to that used in the skin of passenger aircraft. it no longer glowed like the light from before, and it was clearly, a three-dimensional object. i thought, it's an airliner on approach to sydney's nearby, victoria international airport. but, it just couldn't be, it lacked wings, windows, and notably, it had no tail section. it was, for all intents and purposes, an aluminum cigar tube suspended in the sky. seeking additional witnesses, i turned to the couple nearby and asked "do you see that?", and then quickly turned back to look at the object. to my dismay and great disappointment, it was gone. the nearby, single engine, otter float plane, that was near to it but farther away, was still in evidence, but the ball and tube were no where to be seen. my fellow passengers asked me what i had been referring to, and all i could do was mumble something about, how much fun the birds were having today. i continued to search the sky for anything matching its description but saw nothing else. the float plane continued on, toward vancouver island. i walked the passenger deck listening to my other passengers conversations, hoping to hear mention of the object. nothing. . after arriving at swartz bay, i stopped and made a call to harbour air, at coal harbour, vancouver. i spoke with their go-to guy and he said that the float plane i had seen might have been one of theirs, but none of their pilots had reported anything unusual. he had enough personal interest to put in a call to the pilot of the last plane to arrive in victoria. i waited and eventually was told that nothing had changed. i remember thinking to myself, someone new i had seen the object and that they were embarrassed my seeing it. i let it go and thought nothing of it until, i inadvertently watched a podcast called, "dan ackroyd, unplugged on ufo's". during the podcast they aired footage taken in venice, california, in 2004. during the podcast i recognized the very same characteristics of light and motion as appeared in the circular object i first noted, on august 2nd, 2007.
Summary: Bright crome/mercury circle light in daytime sky
trends: There have been no other sightings in Sydney
This sighting has never been favorited.
